page.title: 02Housing, Rangeworthy
page.content: {A group of children}carried out a survey on housing in the area, concentrating on North Rangeworthy, Bagstone and West End. These are some of the results. {Only a small number of houses}have been built since World War 2. Most of the local houses are quite old. About half of them are over 100 years old. {The most common building material}is stone although some of the newer houses and bungalows are built in brick or have rendered walls. {Three quarters of the houses}have 6,7 or 8 rooms but several have 11 or 12 rooms. As for bedrooms, most houses in the sample have 3 or 4 bedrooms. {The children decided}that they were fortunate with their housing conditions, particularly as most of them also have big gardens.
